Class EffectHandler

java.lang.Object
sk.stuba.fiit.EffectHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Effectable
public class EffectHandler extends Object implements Effectable, Cloneable, Serializable
Manages and applies Effect objects to an Effectable entity. This class handles the addition, removal, and application of effects, as well as updating them over time.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    EffectHandler()
    Constructs a new EffectHandler with an empty list of effects.

      public EffectHandler()
      Constructs a new EffectHandler with an empty list of effects.

  • Method Details

    • getEffects

      public List<Effect> getEffects()
      Gets the list of effects currently applied.
      Returns:
      a list of applied effects

    • getEffect

      public Effect getEffect(Class<? extends Effect> effectClass)
      Gets a specific effect based on its class type.
      Parameters:
      effectClass - the class type of the effect
      Returns:
      the effect of the specified class, or null if not found

    • takeEffect

      public void takeEffect(Effect effect)
      Applies an effect to the entity. If the effect already exists, it is removed first before reapplying.
      Specified by:
      takeEffect in interface Effectable
      Parameters:
      effect - the effect to be applied

    • takeEffect

      public void takeEffect(Collection<Effect> effect)
      Applies a collection of effects to the entity.
      Parameters:
      effect - a collection of effects to be applied

    • updateEffects

      public void updateEffects(float deltaTime)
      Updates the state of all effects based on the elapsed time.
      Specified by:
      updateEffects in interface Effectable
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time elapsed since the last update

    • clone

      public EffectHandler clone()
      Creates a deep copy of this EffectHandler, including all applied effects.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a cloned EffectHandler with cloned effects
